title: FF! Doc | ErrorMessageFormatter
paragraphs: If the exception is a PipeRunException that has parameters set on it, then these parameters are added to a params element in the error message. These parameters can be set from an org.frankframework.pipes.ExceptionPipe.

If you need more control over the layout of the error message, then configure your org.frankframework.core.Adapter or org.frankframework.configuration.Configuration with an ErrorMessageFormatter implementation that can reformat the error message to the desired layout: the XslErrorMessageFormatter for XML error formats or the DataSonnetErrorMessageFormatter for JSON error messages.
This component has no required attributes

This is the default IErrorMessageFormatter implementation that is used when no specific ErrorMessageFormatter has been configured. It wraps an error in an XML or JSON string. XML is the default.

{@inheritClassDoc }

If the exception is a PipeRunException that has parameters set on it, then these parameters are added to a params element in the error message. These parameters can be set from an org.frankframework.pipes.ExceptionPipe.

If you need more control over the layout of the error message, then configure your org.frankframework.core.Adapter or org.frankframework.configuration.Configuration with an ErrorMessageFormatter implementation that can reformat the error message to the desired layout: the XslErrorMessageFormatter for XML
